results.title: Duke of Wellington
results.creator_credit: Frank Stevens, Clifford Parris and Film House Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “London No 1”.
A visit to Apsley House at Hyde Park Corner in London which belonged to the first Duke of Wellington and houses the Wellington Museum. It is known popularly as No. 1, London.

results.title: Duke Ellington at the White House
results.brief_description: A special guest performance of this world famous jazz man at the White House is captured in this film. Duke Ellington plays before distinguished guests and displays his great talent in what was virtually a ‘command performance’.
results.description: A special guest performance of this world famous jazz man at the White House is captured in this film. Duke Ellington plays before distinguished guests and displays his great talent in what was virtually a ‘command performance’.

results.title: Drunken boat = Bateau ivre
results.creator_credit: Alfred Chaumel, Henri Beauvais and Franfilmdis
results.brief_description: After the poems of J. Arthur Rimbaud and the symphony “Bateau Ivre” by Robert Bergmann. Prelude for two voices Simon Gantillon and the voice of Rimbaud is Jean-Luis Barrault. In French with no English subtitles.

results.title: Drugs Are Not the Problem
results.brief_description: In themselves drugs are not a problem but their abuse is. The film shows young people using various drugs and the penultimate consequence of addiction. There is a clear, diagrammatic representation of how the human mind and nervous system work and how drugs affect them. Above all, the film repeatedly points out that the human mind is capable of the greatest powers.

results.title: Drugs and beyond
results.creator_credit: Extension Media Center, University of California
results.brief_description: Raises the question of whether a variety of mind controlling substances can be used for positive purposes such as increased learning power, memory stimulation, accelerated maturing processes, mood change or tension control. The emphasis is on manipulation of consciousness or behaviour rather than alteration or awareness expansion.

results.title: Drug of choice
results.creator_credit: Alfred Kelman and Searle Educational Systems
results.brief_description: A film about alcoholism showing it as a chronic disease which gets progressively worse. A key factor is the career phenomenon, with the process starting during lunch.

results.title: Drug abuse: self awareness for high school students - fear
results.brief_description: John persuades Suzanne to collect a consignment of drugs for him. She, at first unwilling eventually agrees. During the film there are inserts of comments by people on drug taking, trust, child/parent relationships, police, fear, etc.

results.title: Drivers I have known and hated
results.brief_description: Looks at some of the most aggravating and dangerous drivers on the roads today and identifies many frustrating and hazardous situations caused by drivers with poor attitudes. Inspires viewers to examine their own driving habits.

results.title: Drive smart: improve your driving skills before you take the test (PC)
results.brief_description: Drive smart is an interactive package designed to assist learner drivers in improving driver education, safety and skills, before taking the all important driver’s licence test. Each module will help you become familiar with the necessary responses and actions required when driving, including scanning and hazard perception and making judgements on a number of driving scenarios and quizzes. It is emphasised that this is a training supplement and is not designed to replace supervised driving practice. “Drive smart” was developed with the assistance of Monash University Accident Research Centre over a period of three years using state of the art driving simulators. For more information visit www.drivesmart.vic.gov.au.
